p: Terpenoids represent diverse class of molecules that provide a wealth of opportunities to address many human health and societal issues. Euphorbia neriifolia L. is an herb local to Southeast Asia. From leaves of E. neriifolia, 23 compounds were isolated, including 22 triterpenoids and one flavonoid glycoside [ 57]. The antiviral activity of all the isolated compounds was evaluated. The assay results indicated the highly influence of the antiviral activity with small differences in the structural features of the tested compounds. Among the friedelane derivatives tested, two epimers, 3 β- friedelanol and 3 α-friedelanol, with difference orientation at C-3 that affected dramatically their antiviral activity while epitaraxerol ( 25) ( Fig. 7 ), a taraxerane derivative, was the most active derivative [ 57].
